alert.note: Alert for Sanilac; St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SANILAC AND NORTHEASTERN ST. CLAIR COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1114 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Peck to near Yale to near Memphis. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Port Huron, Croswell, Yale, Lexington, Port Sanilac, Lakeport, Marysville, Peck, Carsonville, Emmett, Applegate, Melvin, Brockway, Watertown, Blaine, Columbus, North Street, Amador, Fort Gratiot, and Avoca. This includes the following highways... I-94 between mile markers 261 and 273. I-69 between mile markers 185 and 199. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
